title: 109_hr5740
content: The text chunk is about the removal of the 18 or 36-month limitation on COBRA continuation coverage. The text chunk amends ERISA to remove the specified maximum required period for continuation coverage and allows for increased premiums for additional coverage after the 18th month of continuation coverage. The text chunk modifies ERISA to adjust premiums for continuation coverage after the 18th month, referencing the Secretary of Health and Human Services for determining the percentage. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to remove specified deadlines for continuation coverage. Additionally, increased premiums are allowed for additional coverage after the 18th month of continuation coverage. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to remove specified deadlines for continuation coverage under the Public Health Service Act. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to remove specified deadlines for continuation coverage under the Public Health Service Act. The last sentence of section 2202(3) of the Act is amended to allow increased premium for additional coverage after the 18th month of continuation coverage. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 determines continuation coverage periods for group health plans under the FEHBP. Premiums can be increased for additional coverage after the 18th month of continuation. The amendment made by the Health Insurance For Life Act of 2006 affects continuation coverage under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 for group health plans. Premiums may increase after the 18th month of continuation. The Health Insurance For Life Act of 2006 impacts continuation coverage under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 for group health plans. Premiums may rise after the 18th month of continuation. The amendments made by subsections (a) through (c) will apply to group health plans and health insurance coverage for plan years starting after the enactment date, while subsection (d) amendments will apply to contract years starting after the enactment date, with exceptions for collective bargaining agreements. The amendments made by subsections (a) through (c) of the Health Insurance For Life Act of 2006 will not apply to group health plans covered by collective bargaining agreements ratified before the enactment date for plan years starting before the termination of the agreements or 2 years after the enactment date. Plan amendments solely to comply with requirements of collective bargaining agreements are exempt. Amendments to a plan to comply with collective bargaining agreement requirements will not terminate the agreement.
